IN THE COURT OF THE JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE OF THE FIRST CLASS- III
THIRUVANANTHAPURAM
Present: Sri. Arunkumar.P
Judicial Magistrate of the First Class- IT
(in-charge of Judicial Magistrate of First Class -ITT)
Thursday 6" day of February 2025
CC. No.646/2022
Complainant : State represented by the Sub Inspector police, Thampanoor
police station (Crime No. 896/22).
(By Asst. Public Prosecutor)
Accused 1 : Vishnu, S/o Kannan, Puthuval Puthen veedu, TC 784873,,
Titanium, near St. Mary’s Church, Balanagar, Vettucaud
ward, Kadakampally village.
2 : Jackson, aged 28 years, S/o Thomas, TC. 81/147,
Thyvilakom house, near St. Thomas Football ground,
Valiyaveli, Poundkadavu ward, Attipra village.
3 : Syamkumar, aged 42 years, S/o Surendran, TC 43/1390(1),
Thumpottu veedu, near Chiraickal Thampuram temple,
Muttathara ward, Muttathara village.
Offence : U/S. 118(a) of Kerala Police Act.
Order : Accused no. 2 is convicted and sentenced to pay fine of
Rs.500/- for the offence punishable u/s. 118(a) of Kerala
Police Act. In default of payment of fine, accused shall
undergo simple imprisonment for a period of 10 days. Case
against accused no. 1 and 3 is refiled as CC.181/2025.
Heard, perused the records and passed the following:
JUDGMENT
1. This case has arisen on a final report filed by the Sub Inspector of Police, Thampanoor
Police Station in crime No. 896/2022 alleging the commission of offence against the

accused under Section 118(a) of Kerala Police Act.

2. Accused no. 2 pleaded guilty. Charge was framed under Section 118(a) of
Kerala Police Act was read over and explained to the accused and he pleaded
guilty. This court is convinced that the plea of the accused is voluntary. Hence
his plea is accepted. The accused no. 2 is found guilty for the offence
u/s. 118(a) of Kerala Police Act and he is convicted thereunder.

3. Accused no. 2 is convicted and sentenced to pay fine of Rs.500/- for the offence
punishable w/s.118(a) of Kerala Police Act. In default of payment of fine, accused
shall undergo simple imprisonment for a period of 10 days. Case against accused
no. 1 and 3 is refiled as CC.181/2025.

( Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by her, corrected and
pronounced by me, in open court, on this the 6” day of February, 2025.)
Sd/-
Judicial Magistrate of the First Class- II(I/C)
Thiruvananthapuram
